title: Benziger 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Simple in its offerings of juicy pear and fennel flavor, this light-bodied white is ready for the table, subdued in a backbone of buttery oak.

title: Brangero 2016  Dolcetto di Diano d'Alba
description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting black-skinned fruit and baking spice. The round, simple palate has dried black cherry, clove and raw almond notes. Drink soon.

title: Dalton 2016 Estate Fumé Blanc (Galilee)
description: Pale straw in color, this wine has a nose of grapefruit and rose petal. It's very soft on the palate, with passion fruit, lemon and rose flavors and a drawn-out, fruit-filled finish.

title: Davis Bynum 2016 Virginia's Block Jane's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Matchstick aromas are joined by a fleshy tropical character that defines this wine, which is aged in stainless steel drums, neutral French oak and a touch of new Acacia. Robust and ripe, it offers a boldness of vanilla and melon.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2016 Made With Organically Grown Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Tupungato)
description: Smoky plum aromas give way to a crisp palate with sheer acidity. Flavors of tomato, plum and cherry are more raw than voluptuous. On the finish, this racy Cab displays enamel-peeling acidity and a can't-miss sense of freshness.

title: Domaine les Pins 2016 Cuvée les Rochettes Rosé (Bourgueil)
description: The wine is tight with acidity and red-currant fruitiness. Made from Cabernet Franc, it is crisp, cut through with a lively, mineral texture. Drink now.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2015 Grande Côte de la Vallée  (Sancerre)
description: The wine has a lean texture, presenting fruit that is shot through with tight acidity. Cherry flavors are firmly balanced with tannins and a dry core. Definitely cool-climate Pinot Noir.

title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 White (Alentejano)
description: This simple wine is all about crisp citrus and apple fruits that keep it bright and lively. It offers a tight texture and good fruitiness at the end. Drink now.

title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Guarda Rios Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: This soft, spicy wine has easy fruitiness. Black currants are balanced with acidity and a bright aftertaste. This great-value wine is ready to drink.

title: Jérôme Gueneau 2016 Domaine des Grandes Perrières  (Sancerre)
description: Open, friendly and lively fruit dominate this crisp clean wine. It comes from one of three estates owned by the Gueneau family. Spice and lively acidity finish this immediately drinkable wine.

title: Judd's Hill 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Jalapeño and green-bean savory flavor is joined by a freshly cut grass feel in this lively light-bodied white. It is spritzy in acidity and has a taste of just-squeezed lemon.

title: OZV 2015 Red (California)
description: Vivid red-cherry and raspberry flavors and a rather high level of sweetness make this medium-bodied wine seem light and easy. A vanilla accent and soft texture come through on the palate.

title: Hunter's 2013 Jane Hunter Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This is a light, crisp wine for current drinking. Herbal notes make the cherry fruit resemble cherry tomatoes, while the acids carry through the tart finish.

title: J. Wilkes 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Smashed pomegranate and raspberry aromas meet with underlying mocha, herbs and plum skins on this bottling. The palate's sour-plum flavor slides into turned loam and dried herb, which makes the wine complex but not quite delicious. A bit more time may smooth it out.

title: Eric Louis 2016 Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: Ripe tropical fruit flavors give this wine from Sancerre producer Eric Louis its warm character. It has enough acidity to cut through the richness and give it a fruity aftertaste. It's ready to drink.
designation: Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly

title: Grizzly Peak 2014 Merlot (Rogue Valley)
description: This feels a bit thin, even in this warm, ripe vintage. Its rhubarb and mountain berry fruit comes with green tannins, finishing with light coffee and mocha suggestions.

title: Piazzo Armando 2016  Dolcetto d'Alba
description: Cooking spice, smoke and just-fermented wine aromas lead the nose in this simple, easygoing red. A bitter almond note tempers the black cherry fruit on the palate. Drink soon.

title: Ponte 2016 Pas Doux Rosé (Temecula)
description: A pleasing shade of pale pink, this is a very austere bottling, with just faint touches of raspberry and tangerine on the nose. There is more light-red fruit and a hint of bubblegum on the palate, which offers decent tannic tension.

title: Manastira 2013 Just Young Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)
description: Ruby in color, this Cabernet Sauvignon has black cherry and black plum aromas and vanilla, cherry and black plum flavors. The finish has a touch of tartness.

title: Kriselle 2014 Cabernet Franc (Rogue Valley)
description: Intense scents and flavors of charred wood and espresso beans take full control here. There's little evidence of the underlying fruit. It's a stylistic choice—one that the winery has clearly embraced.

title: Rain Dance 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This opens with tart purple fruit and underlying minerality before hitting a wall and stopping short and bitter. Give it a lot of aeration if you intend to drink it anytime soon.

title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)
description: Part of a range of single-varietal wines from this producer, this bottling features richly structured and perfumed Touriga Nacional. A firm core gives a minty edge to the blackberry fruits. Drink from 2018.

title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2016 Ardósia Branco White (Tejo)
description: A fruity blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, the two most familiar white grapes of the region, this wine is soft and creamy. The acidity and the green fruits are already refreshing. Drink now.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015 Merlot (Vin de France)
description: Black fruit and soft tannins yield a wine that is rounded with some attractive texture. Its ripe black currant fruitiness is lifted by its crisp acidity. Drink now.

title: Twill 2014 Syrah (Oregon)
description: Tannic and drying, this offers simple black cherry fruit that thins out and finishes quickly. It's just a cut above generic.

title: Ruca Malen 2015 Yauquen Bonarda (Mendoza)
description: Earthy plum and red-berry aromas are suggestive of tomato. This kicks around the palate with lively acidity and hard tannins. Roasted, savory plum and oak flavors taste spicy and peppery, with fruit pushed to the fringes.

title: Stemmari 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sicilia)
description: This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon smells of cassis, underbrush and vanilla. It's easygoing and made to be enjoyed young, its black currant, licorice and cinnamon flavors smoothed with round tannins.

title: Verum 2016 Chardonnay (Alto Valle del Río Negro)
description: Apple aromas set up a chunky palate that tastes of lightly oxidized apple and peach. It finishes solid but basic.

title: Ribafreixo 2016 Pato Frio Antão Vaz (Alentejo)
description: This lively, fruity wine has soft apple flavors and refreshing acidity. A zesty backdrop to the fruitiness gives a light texture. The wine, which comes from one of the cooler regions of Alentejo, is ready to drink.

title: Saget la Perrière 2015 Domaine de la Perrière  (Sancerre)
description: Although this producer is based in Pouilly-sur-Loire, across the Loire, it also has vines in Sancerre. This attractive crisp wine has herbal hints and bright apple and citrus fruit. Drink now.
